article.headline: Niagara 88, Marist 82
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Clif Brown had a double-double to lead Niagara to an 88-82 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference win over Marist on Saturday. Brown had 26 points and 13 rebounds for Niagara (10-13, 7-8). It was the fourth straight 20-point game for Brown after moving into the starting lineup to replace Charron Fisher, who suffered a season-ending knee injury. Lorenzo Miles had 27 points and J.R. Duffey had 20 for the Purple Eagles. Jared Jordan led Marist (15-8, 9-6) with 31 points. Will Whittington added 17. Niagara led by 20 with 12:30 left, but Marist cut the lead to four in the final minute. Marist held Niagara without a field goal in the last 8:30, but the Purple Eagles went 28-for-34 from the line in the second half as Marist was forced to foul.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
